intro: Tetracera senegalensis, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the common starfruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture, while the flowers are clustered in umbels. The fruit is edible, though its taste and texture can vary depending on the maturity and species variation.
